data.title: Dentmon MVP round, Bogdanović and Krstić the best scorers
data.meta_description: In his team's victory over Partizan with 89:77, Dentmon had a utility index of 33 and was one of the most responsible for the first victory of the Lithuanian team in the Top 16 stage...
data.text:
Žalgiris basketball player Justin Dentmon is the most useful player of the sixth round of the Top 16 phase of the Euroleague.

As it was announced today on the website of that competition, Dentmon had a utility index of 89 in his team's victory over Partizan with 77:33 and was one of the most responsible for the first victory of the Lithuanian team in the Top 16 phase of the Euroleague.

Dentmon, for whom this is the second MVP title this season, scored 23 points, and also had five rebounds, six assists, one steal and one block each.

CSKA basketball player Nenad Krstić from Moscow and Sergio Rodriguez from Real Madrid collected 26 index points. Krstić scored 24 points in the victory of the Russian team over Galatasaray, while Rodriguez scored 16 points in the duel with Lokomotiv Kuban with only one missed shot.

The best scorers of the sixth round of the Top 16 phase are Krstić and Partizan basketball player Bogdan Bogdanović with 24 points.

With 20,5 points per match, Bogdanović is the best scorer in the Top 16 stage, while Armani's basketball player Keith Langford is the best scorer in the competition with 16,8 points per match.

Galatasaray Pops player Mensa-Bonsu caught the most balls in the previous round, 12, and is the best jumper of the competition so far with 9,3 rebounds per match.

Another basketball player of Galatasaray, Carlos Arroyo, was the best assistant of the round with nine successful passes, while Bogdanović and Bayern player Malcom Delaney recorded the most stolen balls, four each.
